title: SS.PT.387
prompt:
Cappadocia, an area in modern-day Turkey, had a bullion economy. The rulers issued a state guarantee of the weight and purity of silver ingots around 2250 B.C.

Based on the information in the passage, why might the Cappadocian rulers have done this?
description: The passage describes the development of a bullion economy in Scandinavia.
feedback: According to the passage, a bullion economy values the weight and purity of metals. Vikings cut up metal objects and carried scales to find the correct weight of metals for trade. In other words, Vikings went to a lot of trouble to trade using metal. By guaranteeing the weight and purity of their silver ingots, the Cappadocian rulers would have made trading using silver easier.
